definition: to hunt for novelty/to seek novelty

sentences.english: A novelty hound picking morsels from a rotating tray—here's to you.
sentences.chinese: 你是一边旋转一边进食的猎奇者，我敬你一杯。

sentences.english: They were very curious in regards to the stran effectivege thing in the box.
sentences.chinese: 他们对盒子里生疏的东西感到很猎奇。

sentences.english: Such a portentous and mysterious monster roused all my curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 这样一个可怕而神秘的怪物激起了我所有的猎奇心。

sentences.english: Do exercise One day XiaShi see why want to ask light into basketball department.
sentences.chinese: 有一天夏实猎奇地问光为什么想到要进篮球部。

sentences.english: King Midnormpretty much 'sly wondered what would happen if he touched himself.
sentences.chinese: 迈达斯王总是猎奇他要是点了自己会怎样。

sentences.english: Keefer didn't wish him to see the car you need to getting curious.
sentences.chinese: 基弗不想要他看见小汽车以至出现猎奇。

sentences.english: She showed great curiosity about my past.
sentences.chinese: 她对我的畴昔隐现出莫大年夜的猎奇。

sentences.english: A love of novelty leads directly to useful experience.
sentences.chinese: 猎奇带来了有用的经验。

definition: (Internet slang) (of a situation, video clip etc) to make one think "wtf!"
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to chase women/to express oneself in a pompous flowery style
